Meu Deus que perfeição de jogo, Portal 1 e Portal 2 literalmente mudaram minha vida, é sem duvida uma das melhores experiências da sua vida, não deixe de jogar, esse preço é pechincha!

very fun puzzle game.  i am generally not that great at puzzles i usually do the 2 things i know work then give up so its nice that this game is just portals and not considering other possible things that much

Portal 2 is the best puzzle game I have played so far. I am not a puzzle fan gamer but the mechanics and physics of portal games is pristine. Just like portal 1 , portal 2 offers a good story and different puzzles. The first half of the game feels like portal 1 but with different puzzles compared to portal 1. In the second half we are introduced to several other new elements like gels etc which give the game a brand new feel. 
One more plus point of portal 2 is that it has many community portal maps to test and solve. In fact the community maps are more innovative and fun to solve.

Portal 2 es una hermosa secuela, con temática interesante y que cumple con la regla básica de hacer una secuela (que el juego sea lo mismo sin ser lo mismo).
La manera en la que explora formas distintas de usar los portales y la física es bastante interesante y muy divertido, la verdad recomiendo este juego en su totalidad y además recomiendo jugarlo con amigos.

My favorite game. I've been gaming for nearly 10 years now, and Portal has been one of the first games I ever bought. The story is incredibly compelling, the interactions with the characters in the game feel very immersive and the humor just overall makes what might have been relatively dull exploration absolutely captivating.
I ran this game on an i5 laptop without a graphics card and the only lag I encountered was at the very start of the game. After that, it's incredibly stable and is pretty much the best performing game, FPS-wise, at 60FPS nearly constantly.
Definitely recommend buying it, but even more so Portal 1 before Portal 2, even though you can just play Portal 2 on its own and it won't take away from the experience.

Also, Portal 1 doesn't have multiplayer (co-op), Portal 2 does. I was able to play this game with my grandpa and he absolutely loves it. Thank you, Valve, for giving me the chance to bond with him even though we live overseas from each other.

It says I've "played this game for 4 hours", but I've played this game on every computer I've ever owned (with the exception of the Apple 2e my dad got when I was a tiny human). I do, and will ALWAYS recommend this game to everyone. If you haven't played it, play it NOW. You'll thank me later.

Absolutely beautiful game in my opinion, no matter if Singleplayer or Co-op.

Singleplayer has a beautiful atmosphere, story and great puzzles that later on gain elements to create a right path yourself.

Multiplayer makes me appreciate how interesting this game is when using 4 Portals.
You can brag about your multiplayer progress to your new friends and it always ends the same:
Either you troll each other only 10% of the time and get through pretty quick.
Or you troll each other 90% of the time and probably need an entire day or more to only finish one chapter.
That would be sad, if it weren't so funny

Великое продолжение первой части: прохождение подарило только положительные эмоции. Было много всяких насыщенных моментов, поворотов, сцен и локаций. Диалоги можно выложить в отдельный сборник цитат, персонажей на целые теории, ну и вы сами всё поняли. Геймплей тут всего часов на 15-20, но они будут уникальными и незабываемыми! Советую каждому человеку на земле, ведь это уже классика.

Best duology out there (along with Half- Life and L4D). Never, never disappoints. The story is something else. Really hilarious, but also very serious. You will scratch your head at what the solution the puzzle was, v=but it turns out it was right in front of you.
There are also community made puzzle maps which are also very good; and adds to the varied experience.

My brother and I powered through this game (it took 12 hours, of course not all at one time haha) and I have to say, it has been a very long time since I have played a game or seen a movie come out with the level of heart and subplot that was put into Portal 2. The game has it all: innovate game play (and lots of it!) through several maps, a heart-wrenching backstory, and a finale that is both unexpected and satisfying... and there is even more to story in extras, where you can finally see how everything comes together.

There are also cooperative play options (which count as canon, since you play as testing bots), and you can build your own testing chambers, although I have yet to try that out yet.

Final verdict: Portal 2 is innovate, fun, intriguing, and unexpectedly hilarious. I have heard that a Portal movie is in the works... but in my opinion, it's already been made right here. My only qualm would be that it can be really, really HARD sometimes. But if you get stuck, just stay calm, take a break, and come back to the level later, and you'll get it!

Happy portaling!
